bill.title: Mississippi Private Protective Services Act; create.
bill.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Private Protective Services Act; To Require Licensure For Engaging In A Private Protective Services Profession Or Activity In This State; To Define Certain Terms As Used In The Act; To Create The Private Protective Services Board And Establish Its Membership; To Provide For The Powers Of The Board; To Create The Position Of Director Of The Private Protective Services Board Within The Department Of Public Safety; To Grant Investigative Powers To The Attorney General To Investigate Complaints Of Licensees; To Provide License Requirements; To Require Liability Insurance; To Require Registration Of Unarmed Security Guards As A Regular Employee; To Provide For The Denial, Suspension Or Revocation Of License; To Require Firearm Registration Permit And Firearms Training For Armed Licensees; To Provide For Enforcement Of The Act; To Provide For Reciprocity With Other States; To Require Continuing Education; To Create The Private Protective Services Education Fund In The State Treasury To Be Used For The Education Of Licensees And Registrants As Deemed Appropriate By The Board; And For Related Purposes.
